## The Game of Life: A Simulated World

The Game of Life is a fun math game invented by John Conway. It uses simple rules to create complex patterns. Think of it like a digital ant farm. You start with some "cells" on a grid. These cells follow basic rules to decide if they stay alive, die, or create new cells.  Some patterns, called "gliders," can even move across the grid! The game is "zero-player" because once you set up the starting pattern, the game plays itself, showing how the cells evolve over time.
